name: Movies of Tom Cruise Online Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: "The Color of Money" was a (delayed) sequel to what movie?
questions.explanation:
The Hustler.

	Paul Newman reprised his role as "Fast Eddie" Felson in this follow up to "The Hustler".

Timothy Hutton.

	Hutton and Cruise (and George C. Scott) star in a tale of youthful rebellion.

questions.text: "Born On The Fourth of July" describes the life of a veteran of what war?
questions.explanation:
Vietnam.

	Ron Kovic was the author of the book that gave rise to the movie. Kovic was paralyzed in Vietnam.

Barry Levinson.

	Kubrick directed "Eyes Wide Shut", Reiner directed "A Few Good Men", and Howard directed "Far and Away".

questions.text: "Far and Away" is set in which of these countries?
questions.explanation:
Ireland.

	Irish Cruise and Kidman seek a better life.

questions.text: During what time period is "The Last Samurai" set?
questions.correct: Shortly after the American Civil War
options: Shortly before the American Civil War
questions.explanation:
Shortly after the American Civil War.

	Cruise plays a veteran of the Civil War.

questions.text: Who did NOT co-star with Tom in "The Firm"?
questions.explanation:
Jason Robards.

	Brimley, Hackman and Holbrook all provide fine supporting work in this John Grisham-based movie.

Eyes Wide Shut.

	All were Tom Cruise movies, but "Eyes" also had Kidman in the cast.

questions.text: In what sport does Cruise engage in "A Few Good Men"?
questions.explanation:
Softball.

	Cruise relaxes by playing (and watching) softball. Tom's best movie (in my opinion). (For the benefit of the anal compulsives in the crowd, Cruise technically played "softball".)

questions.text: Which movie did NOT include Tom Cruise in the cast?
questions.explanation:
Days of Heaven.

	Cruise starred in "Days of Thunder". "Days of Heaven was an entirely different movie".
